reviews.content: Notes are for the H. Cummings edition.

A bit simple, but if you're not out to overload the senses it's very drinkable.I like the bottle shape which sits well in the hand when pouring, as well as the flared opening with the oversized wood topper.
reviews.nose: Light, fruity and surpricingly fresh.Lots of juicy apples and a few peaches.Mild fudge, very faint vanilla and oak.
reviews.taste: Very light,almost watery, sweet malt, some hazelnutts arriving midway. Burnt honey turning spicy.
reviews.finish: Spice lingers a little, turning slightly bitter, dry and woody.

reviews.content: N: spicy - some nutmeg, apple, butter and some syrupT: spicy, coconut, apple, honey, leather and bitterF: iron, marmalade and oilynot my cup of tea

I find myself at the Cardhu distillery having only had one Cardhu before WB. Let’s make up for that and try six [starting with the NAS WB]C: The 12yo is rather like the Glenmorangie 10yo, where the 'original' 10yo is often considered the best [or just as good] as any in their core range. Even the most balanced Cardhu, the 15yo [in hindsight] was arguably still a bit 'over cooked'. The 12yo sits about right with regards to balance between spirit and cask. Let’s move to the 15yo now WB.Scores a C[+]

reviews.nose: Soft, some smoke, honey, vanilla, fruity
reviews.taste: Malty sweet, honey, fruity
reviews.finish: Long, some peat, sweet

reviews.nose: Sweet aromas of delicatefruits, especially ripe pear clearly perceive, and  oak
reviews.taste: A beautiful palette of  grain, sugar, vanilla and peaches with honey and spices and pleasant hints of  peat
reviews.finish: A pure finish with clear  tones of oak, malt, vanilla and warm with peaches in the background a persistent  taste of smoke gently wiping

reviews.content: An acclaimed single malt whisky, the Cardhu 12 Year is a charming Speyside whisky with a pleasant sweet character. Loved by many, but the competition for its superior quality and delicious flavors and aromas.  Intense and fragrant whisky is a fruity and floral, with notes of vanilla, honey and licorice. Medium-bodied, soft, light and delicate, silky character. The palate is well balanced, with traces of wood, earth and citrus. Persistent, do you remember the combination of sweet and smoky with just a pleasant aftertaste.A whisky that proudly called Cardhu with it may carry with it, great! Intense and fragrant whisky is a fruity and floral, with notes of vanilla, honey and licorice. Medium-bodied, soft, light and delicate, silky character. The palate is well balanced, with traces of wood, earth and citrus. Persistent, do you remember the combination of sweet and smoky with just a pleasant aftertaste.

reviews.nose: Delicate, sweet, floral, perfume, apples, jelly, grapes.
reviews.taste: Nutty, caramel, toffee, but you can smell the alcohol.
reviews.finish: Alcoholic, even warming, nothing worth mentioning

reviews.content: A quite pleasant, silky-soft brandy, which unfortunately has little to offer in terms of sustainability due to the very weak barrels and the rather low alcohol content. Instead, the slightly furry mouthfeel shows that one or the other barrel that is no longer usable has also found its way into the bottling. Nonetheless, it's drinkable and enjoyable, although it could be better.
reviews.nose: A quite pleasant, silky-soft brandy, which unfortunately has little to offer in terms of sustainability due to the very weak barrels and the rather low alcohol content. Instead, the slightly furry mouthfeel shows that one or the other barrel that is no longer usable has also found its way into the bottling. Nonetheless, it's drinkable and enjoyable, although it could be better.
reviews.taste: Light honey, apple chips, candied orange peel, delicate barley, sweetish aromas that appear perfumed, toasted Italian white bread, roasted almonds, unobtrusive oak, quite herbaceous, watery cocoa drink
reviews.finish: In short, sweet vanilla, latte macchiato, the oak wakes up but quickly falls asleep again, a perfumed, furry mouthfeel arises, sprayed once too much with the deodorant with the mouth open, slightly peppery, one or the other smoke molecule shows up

reviews.content: It's not bad, but it's also a bit boring. I think I've moved away from that now.
reviews.nose: Fresh, fruity, sweet, floral
reviews.taste: Fruity, peach, floral, slightly malty, a hint of smoke, oak
reviews.finish: pleasantly sweet and melty, quite short

reviews.content: Very easyand drinkable, although nothing special. Great one for a switch fromblends to single malt
reviews.nose: Color is probably fake, on the nose some very basic apple,straw and burned toast
reviews.taste: Very light,very close to a modern blended whisky. Lot's of grain and maltysweetness
reviews.finish: Almost none

reviews.content: Balanced.
reviews.nose: Light, appetizing, hints of greengage, and the gentlest touch of smoke.
reviews.taste: Light to medium in flavour, with the emphasis on malty sweetness and vanilla.
reviews.finish: A lingering, syrupy sweetness, but also a rounder dryness with late hints of peat.

reviews.content: A simple knitted single malt for every occasion - 06.03.2014
reviews.nose: Fruity, sour, green apple, fresh, floral, malt sweet, pear, hazelnut,
reviews.taste: Malt sweetness, flower meadow, apple, honeydew melon, a bit tart
reviews.finish: medium

reviews.content: The price / performance ratio is very good.
Fruity and malty aroma, vanilla, green apples, oranges, ripe melon, mint and mango. Vanilla sweet taste, mint, nutmeg, orange marmalade, toffee and malt. Medium long, sweet and malty end.

reviews.nose: sugarcane,pear, cream, bread, toffee, vanilla
reviews.taste: malty, sweet, syrup, red apples, vanilla,honey, bitter spice, grain
reviews.finish: short, woodsy honey, grain, pears,slightly bitter sharp alcohol at the back

reviews.content: Excellent for flaming pancakes.
reviews.nose: Alcohol for macerating fruits, young wood, malted barley, very green fruits ...
reviews.taste: Sugar, green fruits, wood. Fairly acrid and untied.
reviews.finish: Average. Wood, vanilla, unripe quince, very green apple.

reviews.content: This drop has a concept / program in development. Do not skin it, but this whisky has no flaws, which is worth a lot for such a cheap mass product.
reviews.nose: very elegant: smells infinitely deep of slightly sour malt, surrounded by sweet fruits (apple?)
reviews.taste: Heather and honey
reviews.finish: spicy, the fruitiness turns into pear, light vanilla, with a slight - not unpleasant - pungency

reviews.content: by and large, everything behave fairly; There are other 12s where there is more to experience
reviews.nose: sweetish, a little sherry, a little pear, heather, light smoke and resin
reviews.taste: semi-dry sherry, soft, mild (there is not really much)
reviews.finish: rather short, tockner, very slightly bitter but no chocolate or the like

reviews.nose: Sultanas, barley sugar, toffee, apple cider, vanilla and woodspice, these last two come through stronger with water
reviews.taste: A bit of rushed spirit bite, apples, vanilla, honey, nuts, bit of wood spice.
reviews.finish: Medium, rich honey and light fruits like pears and a bit of peach.

reviews.content: Really nothing extraordinary, not bad but simple, too simple!
reviews.nose: round and fruity, pear notes
reviews.taste: malty, slightly boiled, on vanilla, fruits and spices
reviews.finish: honey and oak

reviews.content: a very good enjoyable whisky.  Find the whisky really well, especially the flavors are very recognizable.
reviews.nose: honey, aromatic, nutty, some wood notes, sweet
reviews.taste: sweet, enjoyable
reviews.finish: dray, not so long (middle),

reviews.content: Sorry, Sorry, I'm disappointed.  What a heavy, "bready" whisky. Just like you're having breakfast with half-baked balls.  Flour, milk, yeast and sometimes a refreshing touch of fruit .  Unfortunately no stayer in my bar.

Cardhu Aged 12 Years, 40%, SMSW. 50ml miniature at home, June 2025. Dark golden yellow and stated to be ‘mit farbstoff’. Aroma is pineapple cube sweets, apple flavoured bonbons (or just a mix of green apple and icing sugar), slight menthol, a soft buttery oakiness. Pretty nice aroma. Body is watery+. Taste is very flat and soft. Watery with the slightest sting in the tail. A vibe of vodka and soda maybe, but with some bitter oak tannins in the finish – white pepper and a light astringency. I’m not convinced I understand who this might be aimed at – leaning too bitter to be an introduction to whisky, but lacking anything that would make it particularly appealing to anyone else. Not unpleasant but has a very flat profile with a focus on the bitter oak tannins. Okay stuff - not bad but below average. 3.25/78
Not my favorite whisky.
reviews.nose: very light, like could be expected with Cardhu.Very little cask influences, light barley sweetness, caramelaroma's blendlikely
reviews.taste: Sweet, malty, waiting for some development, but no...only bitterness comes on the palate
reviews.finish: Not very pleasant, bitter finish

reviews.content: A nice dram.
reviews.nose: Apples and pears slightly caramelized. Malt. Light elegant woody.
reviews.taste: Always the fruits of the orchard. Net, oily and full mouth despite 40%
reviews.finish: Warm and quite short.

reviews.content: Low complexity, barley sugar malt cereals, slight bitterness and spices. You can make out Johnnie Walker red character and almost taste the artificial color flavours and influence of chill filtering. Budget, easy sipping and entry level.
Not too complex, but definitely not bad + the price is more than pleasant
reviews.nose: Sushi, vanilla, chocolate, oranges, raisins, mint
reviews.taste: Sweet, creamy, background citrus, lime, gooseberry and gently spicy
reviews.finish: Cream, chocolate, some grain, matolin, latte macchiatto

reviews.content: This one is ok. It lacks body and power, it's not complex, but I trend to prefer this one to the 15 since the oaky side is less noticable.
reviews.nose: Shy, on apple and malt. A bit suggary and not extremely expressive.
reviews.taste: Light, on apple. Less suggary than the nose. Not bad, but not unforgetable.
reviews.finish: Short

reviews.content: A lovely, fruity dram, perfect for starters and always pleasant.
The first Single Malt i have rated that low.
See pm
An easy to drink malt. Nothing very special, this would be a good beginner's whisky I think. Not one to stay up for though. Drink as an aperitif.
reviews.nose: Honey and tingly. Quite fruity on the nose, with a slight oaky, spicy note. Oranges, light fruits and malt.
reviews.taste: Surprisingly bitter at first. The tongue needs to warm up here. Tingly again, after which it gets softer and sweeter. Again honey, but the bitter note lingers in the background. Very malty towards the end. Fruit is harder to find now.
reviews.finish: Short to medium length. Sweet from the honey/vanilla and malt. A spicy note is still here. Watery at the end, so make that a short finish.

reviews.nose: Sweet, slightly fermented fruits / a little alcoholic.
reviews.taste: Watery, a hint of honey sweetness
reviews.finish: Very short

reviews.nose: pears, apple, grapes
reviews.taste: heavy oak, malt, light sweetness, spices
reviews.finish: short fruity finish, long taste of oak and grain

reviews.content: One of the poorest single malts with age declaration I had. The nose is a little deceiving, but the rest fails to deliver completely. Alcoholic, unbalanced and honestly, lacking distinct taste. Would not recommend for any purpose, apart from the actual bottle (containter)
Nose: AcidicTaste: Mild and neutralFinish: Dry, saltA bit boring and characterless, lacks complexity

reviews.nose: Vanilla, malt, roasted walnuts, apple, subtle smoke, mead
reviews.taste: Sweet, watery, vanilla, honey
reviews.finish: roasted nuts, honey sweetness

reviews.content: The nose is fresh with apple, lime, lemon and green fresh notes with a hint of peat smoke. Nice sweet taste, smooth on the tongue and no burning.   Only a drop of water needed.
Your basic malty Speyside, nothing off putting and nothing outstanding.

reviews.nose: Dry grass, chocolate and a hint of smoke
reviews.taste: Smooth malt, milkchocolate and fruit
reviews.finish: Sweet but still dry.

reviews.content: Fairly light, fruity whisky without much depth that has been coloured. Beginner's paint at a low price that doesn't leave a lasting impression.
A delicious malt whisky with a nice full flavor with honey and nuts in a beautiful carafe with a beech wood stopper.
basic whisky
Very well structured, it is an easy access whisky.
reviews.nose: Dominated by the pear, it is reminiscent of a pear sorbet (like a Norman hole). You can also detect honey spikes.
reviews.taste: Very soft and slightly oily, in the continuity of the nose.
reviews.finish: Medium length, a woody taste comes out in addition to the previous flavors.

reviews.content: I am not a fan. Maybe the most boring and insipid whisky I have ever tasted. Also it swims like a rock.
reviews.nose: Almost not there. Some astringent alcohol, a little bit of toasted cereal, and hint of oak.
reviews.taste: Very thin and weak. Bitterness from the oak, again with the not-so-pleasant alcohol note. An afterthought of apples or pears.
reviews.finish: Shorty McShorts. The unpleasant alcohol is gone though. Akvavity.

reviews.content: Very little flavor, too inoffensive, it tastes like neutral spirit with a tiny bit of wood fragrance added. I won't ever buy a bottle for myself.
A simple whisky, good basis of cereal and wood notes with a light citrus freshness. Nothing extraordinary but decent for the price.

I was a little disappointed with this. I had tried it at a whisky bar once and quite enjoyed it, so when I saw a bottle on the shelf for sale a few years later I jumped at it. But unfortunately, for whatever reason, it didn't live up to the good memory.I found it to be a bit too light, too thin ... not enough of a strong finish for my liking. And the nose is always a bit odd – I always got a strong sensation of chlorine, or turpentine, something like that (though that's nowhere in the taste).

The 12 year old Cardhu was tasted at Mélanie and Eric's. Open bottle for a long time.  Very weak nose, which does not tell me anything that is worth it.  To taste, it reminds me of low standard whiskys such as chivas 12 or dalwhinnie ... I find nothing special except caramel, vanilla. Everything is too sweet, a little sweet.  No finish ...  Disappointing...
Not very flavourful, not to say at all
